opinion.title: Our Oceans - A Documentary Review
opinion.question: Have you seen an interesting TV documentary recently that you learnt a lot from? Write us a review of the documentary. You should explain what the documentary was about, tell us what you learnt from it and say whether other people would find it interesting too.
writingPoints: whether other people would find it interesting
opinion.answer:
Choosing a documentary to watch can be difficult because there are so many options. However, I recently watched one called Our Oceans on the BBC and I learnt a huge amount from it. The documentary explores different parts of the ocean and the creatures that live there.

The thing that really impressed me was how the programme shows different ocean zones. For example, it takes you from the surface down to the deep sea, and also visits coral reefs. The photography is absolutely amazing because the cameras can go very deep underwater and capture things we don't normally see.

What I learnt most about was plastic pollution in our oceans. The documentary explained that around 8 million tons of plastic reach the oceans every year. As a result, I've changed my habits and now I try to use less plastic, especially after seeing how it affects marine animals.

I would definitely recommend this documentary to everyone. It's both educational and beautiful to watch. Whether you're interested in nature or not, you'll find it fascinating. It's one of the best documentaries I've ever seen.

opinion.title: Ed Sheeran at Wembley Stadium
opinion.question: Write us a review of a concert you've been to. It could be a pop, rock or classical concert, or one with a different type of music. Include information on the music, the place and the atmosphere.
opinion.answer:
Last month I went to my first big concert and it was an amazing experience. I saw Ed Sheeran at Wembley Stadium in London. Although I'd watched concerts on TV before, seeing a live performance was completely different.

The thing that impressed me most was the music itself. Ed Sheeran played all his famous songs like Shape of You, Perfect and Thinking Out Loud. What made it special was that it was just him with his guitar and a loop pedal. As a result, it felt very personal even though there were thousands of people there, and everyone was singing along.

The other impressive thing was the atmosphere. Wembley Stadium is absolutely massive and there were about 90,000 people, but surprisingly it still felt quite intimate. The lights, the energy of the crowd and the emotional moments all created an incredible atmosphere.

I would highly recommend going to see Ed Sheeran in concert, even if you're not a huge fan. It's an unforgettable experience and well worth the money. You won't regret it.

opinion.title: Bella Napoli - An Excellent Meal
opinion.question: Write us a review of a restaurant where you had a wonderful meal. Tell us what the restaurant was like, describe what you ate and explain why it was so good.
opinion.answer:
Last weekend I went to a restaurant called Bella Napoli to celebrate my birthday. It's a small Italian restaurant in the city centre and I have to say it was one of the best meals I've ever had.

The first thing that impressed me was the restaurant itself. It's a small, family-run place with a really cosy atmosphere. The staff were extremely friendly and we felt welcome as soon as we arrived. In fact, the owner even came to our table to greet us personally and recommend dishes.

The other thing that made the meal so good was the food quality. I had homemade seafood linguine and it was absolutely delicious. What made it so special was that everything was made from scratch using fresh ingredients. The pasta was cooked perfectly and the seafood tasted incredibly fresh. As a result, it was the best pasta I've ever tasted.

I would highly recommend Bella Napoli to anyone who loves authentic Italian food. The prices are reasonable and the quality is outstanding. It's definitely worth visiting.

opinion.title: The Garden Restaurant - Perfect for Celebrations
opinion.question: We are looking for reviews of restaurants which are good places to celebrate special occasions. In your review you should: describe the restaurant and the food it serves, say what special occasions you would recommend the restaurant for.
writingPoints: describe the restaurant and the food it serves
what special occasions you would recommend the restaurant for
opinion.answer:
I recently took my parents to The Garden Restaurant for their wedding anniversary. After looking at several options, I chose this restaurant because of its excellent reputation, and I wasn't disappointed.

The first thing you notice is the elegant atmosphere. The restaurant has beautiful views of a garden and inside there's soft lighting and candles on every table, which creates a romantic setting. As for the food, they serve modern European cuisine with a seasonal menu. Everything we ordered was beautifully presented and tasted absolutely delicious.

What really makes this restaurant ideal for special occasions is the service. The staff are incredibly attentive without being intrusive. They remember small details and add personal touches like bringing a special dessert with a candle. This means you really feel looked after and it makes the occasion more memorable.

I would definitely recommend The Garden Restaurant for anniversaries, birthdays or engagements. Although it's quite expensive, it's worth it for a special celebration. You'll have a wonderful evening.

opinion.title: Surf Camp in Portugal - A Great Experience
opinion.question: We're looking for reviews of organised holidays where people can practise sports. Write a review of the holiday, including information about the place, the sports, and how well organised the holiday was.
writingPoints: how well organised the holiday was
opinion.answer:
Last summer I wanted to learn how to surf, so I booked a week at a surf camp in Portugal. Choosing which camp to go to was difficult, but I'm really glad I chose Surf Camp Portugal. It was a brilliant week.

The first great thing was the location. The camp is on the Algarve coast, which has beautiful beaches and perfect waves for learning to surf. As for the sports activities, we had daily surf lessons in the morning and afternoon. They divided us into groups based on our level, from complete beginners like me to more advanced surfers.

What impressed me most was how well organised everything was. We had qualified instructors who were patient and encouraging. All the equipment was provided, including wetsuits and boards. Because the groups were small, we got lots of personal attention. As a result, I felt safe and made good progress during the week.

I would highly recommend this surf camp to anyone, whether you're a complete beginner or want to improve your skills. It's great value for money and you'll have an amazing time.

opinion.title: Lonely Planet Spain - An Excellent Guidebook
opinion.question: We're looking for reviews of a good guidebook to your city or country. In your review you should include information about: the contents of the book, what makes the book useful and interesting, why it's better than similar guidebooks.
writingPoints: what makes the book useful and interesting
why it's better than similar guidebooks
opinion.answer:
When I was planning a trip to Spain, I bought the Lonely Planet Spain guidebook. After comparing several different guidebooks, I chose this one and it turned out to be extremely useful.

The book contains comprehensive information about all the major cities and regions in Spain. It includes details about transport options, places to stay and things to see and do. What makes it so useful is that it has detailed maps and lots of practical tips about everything from using public transport to eating out. This means you have everything you need in one book.

What makes this guidebook better than others is that it includes hidden gems, not just the obvious tourist spots. It helped me discover authentic places that most tourists miss. Another great feature is that the reviews are really honest - it tells you what to avoid as well as what's good.

I would definitely recommend Lonely Planet Spain to anyone visiting the country. It's reliable, comprehensive and much better than other guidebooks I've used. It's worth every penny.

opinion.title: Atomic Habits - A Life-Changing Book
opinion.question: Write us a review of a useful book which you have read. In your review describe what the book is about, explain how it was useful to you and say why you would recommend it to others.
writingPoints: how it was useful to you
why you would recommend it to others
opinion.answer:
I was struggling with my studying habits last year, so a friend recommended a book called Atomic Habits by James Clear. I have to say it was incredibly useful and has really helped me.

The book is about how to build good habits and break bad ones. What makes it different from other self-help books is that it gives you practical strategies based on scientific research. For example, it explains how to make new habits easier to start and how to make bad habits harder to continue.

The book was useful to me because I learned that small changes can make a big difference. The author talks about improving by just 1% each day. As a result, I changed my study routine completely. Instead of studying whenever I felt like it, I started studying at the same time every day. This simple change has made me much more productive.

I would highly recommend this book to students or anyone who wants to improve their habits. It's easy to read and the advice is practical and easy to apply. It's definitely worth reading.

opinion.title: Duolingo - A Great Language Learning App
opinion.question: We're looking for reviews of smartphone apps that you find really useful. Write a review describing what the app does, explaining why you find it useful and saying whether you would recommend it to other people.
writingPoints: whether you would recommend it to other people
opinion.answer:
I've been wanting to learn Spanish for a while, so I downloaded an app called Duolingo. I have to say it's been really useful and I've made good progress in just a few months.

Duolingo is a language learning app that teaches through games. You do short daily lessons that cover vocabulary, grammar and pronunciation. What makes it different from traditional language learning is that it's fun and keeps you engaged. It uses things like points, levels and streaks to motivate you to keep learning.

The reason I find it so useful is that the lessons are only 5-10 minutes long, so they fit easily into my busy schedule. This means I can practise every day without it taking too much time. Another great thing is that it's completely free to use. There's a paid version, but the free version has everything you need with no hidden costs.

I would definitely recommend Duolingo to anyone who wants to learn a new language. It's perfect for beginners and makes learning enjoyable rather than boring. It's one of the best apps I've ever used.

opinion.title: The Intern - A Surprising Character
opinion.question: Have you seen a film recently where the main character behaved in a surprising way? Write us a review of the film, explaining what the main character did and why it was surprising. Tell us whether or not you would recommend this film to other people.
writingPoints: whether you would recommend this film
opinion.answer:
I recently watched a comedy called The Intern and I was really impressed by how the main character behaved. The film surprised me in a positive way and kept me entertained throughout.

The film is about a 70-year-old man, played by Robert De Niro, who becomes an intern at a fashion startup run by a young woman. What he did that impressed me was how he brought wisdom and kindness to the company. Despite being the oldest person there, he helped everyone with their problems and became friends with all his young colleagues.

The reason this was so surprising is that I expected him to struggle. I thought the film would be about the generation gap and him not understanding technology or modern work culture. However, it was the opposite - he actually became the most valuable person in the company. This shows that life experience and emotional intelligence are more important than just being young and knowing technology.

I would definitely recommend this film to anyone. It's heartwarming, funny and has a really positive message. You'll really enjoy watching it.

opinion.title: Stardew Valley - An Addictive Farming Game
opinion.question: Have you played a video game recently that you found particularly addictive? Write a review describing the gameplay, the graphics and what makes it so compelling. Would you recommend it to other gamers?
opinion.answer:
I was looking for a relaxing game to play after school and I found Stardew Valley. I have to say it's become incredibly addictive and I've already spent over 100 hours playing it.

Stardew Valley is a farming simulation game where you inherit your grandfather's old farm and have to build it up. You can grow crops, raise animals, go fishing and explore caves. What makes the gameplay so engaging is that there's so much to do. You can also make friends with the townspeople and even get married. The graphics are simple but really charming.

The reason it's so compelling is that it's relaxing but never boring. There's no pressure and you can play at your own pace. However, you always want to play 'just one more day' to see what happens next. Another thing that makes it addictive is the sense of progress - you can see your farm grow and improve, which is really satisfying.

I would highly recommend Stardew Valley to all types of gamers. It's affordable, provides hours of fun and you can play it on almost any device. You won't be able to stop playing!
